channel.title: Awsome Website Tool-- Beginner tool for 1st website!
channel.description:
Well basically this is a very, very easy to use website maker. It takes almost no knowledge of html or anything. (I know that may be upsetting to experience users, but this is more for the new users). [b]30 Day Free Trial:[/b] Download from: [url=http://www.webpage-maker.com/]http://www.webpage-maker.com/[/url] Info:
Web Page Maker is an easy-to-use web page editor that allows you to create and upload web pages in minutes without knowing HTML. Simply drag and drop objects onto the page and position them freely in the layout. It comes with several pre-designed templates that help you to get started. It also includes ready-to-use navigation bars that can be inserted into the page. Additional features include built-in color picker, Java script library, image library and built-in FTP client.
Main Features:
Main Features No html coding is required and you do not need any web experience. Drag and drop the objects. True WYSIWYG layout & design. Create websites with multiple pages and easily manage your site at once. Pre-designed website templates included. Change the color of linked text on mouse over,etc. (See Examples) Ready-to-use Java Script effects are offered. Hundreds of functions: thumbnail, mouse-over effects, ready-to-use Java Script effects, text link style sheet, tables, forms, iFrames and much more... Preview web pages in browser with one-click. Publish your web site with just one-click. What new features would you like to see in a future release? - Tell us right now!
Again very easy to use, and if you don't want to spend the money to buy it after your 30 day trial there are lots of full version downloads and cracks/keygens, etc. Remember that this is piracy and piracy is against the law! You need to buy your products or else you are breakingt he law! I take no responsibility for any trouble you get into for getting a pirated copy![br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 31, 2007, 04:04:11 PM[/size][hr]System Requirements:
System Requirements: Pentium Class CPU (400 MHz or higher recommended) 24 MEG RAM (64 or higher recommended) 16 bit color display (24 recommended) 10 MEG available disk space Windows 95/98/ME/NT4/2000/XP An Internet Explorer 5.0 or higher (IE6.0 or higher recommended)

item.title: Awsome Website Tool-- Beginner tool for 1st website!
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

[quote=“Baros Rocks, post:12, topic:169641”][quote author=xX00java00Xx link=topic=229383.msg1986139#msg1986139 date=1199845475]
Shut up. Nobody likes you Mr. “Junior Member.” Come back when you are a senior like the rest of us. Nooblet
[/quote]

Bad attempt, 1 post that is informative and helpful is better to the majority then 100 posts of spam.[/quote]
bad move when you are “trying” to help newbies at HTML

I still and ONLY use Dreamweaver, but only for 1 single purpose: sizing tables.
other than that, I use PHPDesigner 2008.
WYSIWYG is only good if you are starting out and want to preview it, you may see the source, but not many prefer to that actually buy it to completely use it.

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:13, topic:169641”][quote]Rule 8:
We don’t care about post count alone. If someone has high post count and most of it is spam, we hate them. If someone has high post count with informative posts, we love them. The higher count, the more we hate/love them.[/quote][/quote]

lol coming from the 3rd highest poster in this forum, but 2/3rds of your post are helpful, informative, and well thought out, except the occasional

FUCK YOU

item.source: Awsome Website Tool-- Beginner tool for 1st website!

item.title: Awsome Website Tool-- Beginner tool for 1st website!
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“xX00java00Xx, post:5, topic:169641”][quote author=JV link=topic=229383.msg1967619#msg1967619 date=1199159030]

Cheap WYSIWYG editor.

True but it gets beginners started. Thats why I posted it. Lol I’m kinda bored…

There’s no point posting something useless simply because you’re bored. It’s basically spamming.
And Legit is right. It’s a cheap WYSIWYG editor. If we needed one, do you think it might be in the web design software sticky with dreamweaver etc?

In my opinion, starting with software which makes bad websites is possibly the worst way to learn HTML. Dreamweaver is the #1 website builder for a reason you know. Learning HTML isn’t hard. Playing around with sources and scripts will be alot better than using this software. Guaranteed.

-JV
[/quote]

#1 its not useless
#2 it actualy helps people… You think a newcomer who hasn’t even used html before is going to download dreamweaver and start using it like he knows wtf he is doing? The whole point of this program is to fiddle around and learn. You still have to use the html doccuments and such… its just not as hard so that newcomers learn of a progresion of time.[/quote]

How can you learn HTML from something which contains no html?

Read full topic

Well basically this is a very, very easy to use website maker. It takes almost no knowledge of html or anything. (I know that may be upsetting to experience users, but this is more for the new users).

30 Day Free Trial:
Download from: http://www.webpage-maker.com/

Info:

Web Page Maker is an easy-to-use web page editor that allows you to create and upload web pages in minutes without knowing HTML. Simply drag and drop objects onto the page and position them freely in the layout. It comes with several pre-designed templates that help you to get started. Publish your web site with just one-click. 
      What new features would you like to see in a future release? - Tell us right now!</blockquote>
